title: Data Structures - MODERATE Level
description: Intermediate data structures including trees, linked lists, and graph traversal. (20 Questions - 40 Minutes)

questions.text: What is the time complexity of searching an element in a balanced binary search tree?
Which data structure is used to implement a recursive function?
Which traversal method is used in depth-first search on a graph?
The minimum number of nodes in a binary tree of height 'h' (where root is height 0) is:
Which collision resolution technique in a Hash Table involves calculating a secondary hash function?
In a Singly Linked List, inserting a node at the **end** requires traversing how many nodes in the worst case?
Which of the following is NOT a common tree traversal algorithm?
A complete binary tree with 'n' nodes has a height of (using floor/ceiling notation for clarity):
What is the time complexity of deleting the middle element from a Doubly Linked List (given a pointer to the element)?
In graph theory, a path that visits every vertex exactly once is called a(n):
Which data structure is typically used to implement an adjacency list for a graph?
The process of moving through all the nodes of a Tree is called:
Which of the following is an **advantage** of a Linked List over an Array?
What is the key difference between a Queue and a Deque (Double-Ended Queue)?

options.c: Deque allows insertion/deletion at both ends

questions.text: In Hash Table design, the load factor is defined as:

options.a: Size of the table / Number of elements
options.b: Number of collisions / Size of the table
options.c: Number of elements / Size of the table

questions.text: The Postorder traversal of a Binary Search Tree (BST) is always: (Root is visited last)

options.d: Sorted only if it's a perfect tree

questions.text: Which structure is best for representing a network of cities and the roads connecting them?
What does 'hashing' primarily achieve?

options.c: Mapping a large key space to a smaller address space

questions.text: The process of converting an expression from Infix to Postfix typically uses which data structure?
When comparing an Array to a Linked List, the Array offers better performance for which operation?
